contentrichtext.text: {{other uses|Helen Clark (disambiguation)}} {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Women's [[Field Hockey]]}} {{MedalCountry | {{NZL}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[Commonwealth Games]]}} {{MedalBronze| [[Women's Hockey at the 1998 Commonwealth Games|1998 Kuala Lumpur]]| Team}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Helen Margaret Clarke''' (''nÃ©e'' '''Shearer'''), [[New Zealand Order of Merit|MNZM]] (born 16 April 1971 in [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]]) is a former [[field hockey]] goalkeeper for [[New Zealand]], who competed in three Summer Olympics: 1992, 2000 and 2004. Clarke earned a record 166 caps for her country and received an [[New Zealand Order of Merit|MNZM]] in 2005.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=9005114|title=New Year Honours: Veteran MP heads list with top award|work=The New Zealand Herald|date=31 December 2004}}</ref> She was also a member of the [[Black Sticks Women|New Zealand National Women's Hockey Team (The Black Sticks)]] at the [[1998 Commonwealth Games]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]], where she won a bronze medal, and the [[2002 Commonwealth Games]] in [[Manchester]]. She retired from the sport after the [[2004 Olympic Games]] in [[Athens]]. She has taught physical education and English at Mt Roskill Grammar School in Auckland, New Zealand. ==References== *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/cl/helen-clarke-1.html sports-reference] {{reflist}} {{Navboxes colour |title = New Zealand squads |bg = white |fg = black |list1 = {{New Zealand FHW Squad 1992 Summer Olympics}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 1998 World Cup}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 1998 Commonwealth Games}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 1999 Champions Trophy}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2000 Olympic Qualifier}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2000 Champions Trophy}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2000 Summer Olympics}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2001 Champions Trophy}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2002 Champions Trophy}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2002 World Cup}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2003 Champions Challenge}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2004 Olympic Qualifier}} {{New Zealand FHW Squad 2004 Summer Olympics}} }} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Clarke, Helen | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = New Zealand field hockey player | DATE OF BIRTH = 16 April 1971 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Clarke, Helen}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for New Zealand]] [[Category:Field hockey players at the 1992 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Field hockey players at the 1998 Commonwealth Games]] [[Category:Field hockey players at the 2000 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Field hockey players at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:New Zealand field hockey players]] [[Category:Members of the New Zealand Order of Merit]] [[Category:Olympic field hockey players of New Zealand]] [[Category:People from Auckland]] {{NewZealand-fieldhockey-bio-stub}}
